description.narrative: By 2016, the Haitian educational system and its actors have the means and technical capacities to reduce the vulnerability and the impact of emergency situations on children of preschool and basic education levels.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of skills development for multiple age groups (including in temporary learning spaces)
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities disaster prevention and preparedness
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

title.narrative: Haiti United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Haiti: Evaluation of UNICEF response to Hurricane Matthew
Haiti 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Haiti 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Haiti 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, the Haitian educational system and its actors have the means and technical capacities to reduce the vulnerability and the impact of emergency situations on children of preschool and basic education levels.

description.narrative: By 2016, the Haitian educational system and its actors have the means and technical capacities to reduce the vulnerability and the impact of emergency situations on children of preschool and basic education levels. | Status:Met | As-of Date:09/12/2016

title.narrative: # of teachers who have been trained in the Disaster risk reduction with a gender perspective and support to people with a disability

actual.value: 2016:2400 Explanation: Inspectors (400) and school directors (2000) have been trained in DRR in schools.

title.narrative: Existence of an effective coordination mechanism to prevent and respond to the needs of the education sector in emergency situations

actual.value: 2016:Yes. Although clusters have been discontinued, the emergency unit at the MoE is actively involved in the coordination of emergency activities.

title.narrative: Existence of a contingency plan at the national and departmental level, and updated each year.
